documentation: AWS IoT Greengrass seamlessly extends AWS onto physical devices so they can act locally on the data they generate, while still using the cloud for management, analytics, and durable storage. AWS IoT Greengrass ensures your devices can respond quickly to local events and operate with intermittent connectivity. AWS IoT Greengrass minimizes the cost of transmitting data to the cloud by allowing you to author AWS Lambda functions that execute locally.

AssociateRoleToGroup.documentation: Associates a role with a group. Your Greengrass core will use the role to access AWS cloud services. The role's permissions should allow Greengrass core Lambda functions to perform actions against the cloud.
AssociateRoleToGroup.name: AssociateRoleToGroup

AssociateServiceRoleToAccount.documentation: Associates a role with your account. AWS IoT Greengrass will use the role to access your Lambda functions and AWS IoT resources. This is necessary for deployments to succeed. The role must have at least minimum permissions in the policy ''AWSGreengrassResourceAccessRolePolicy''.
AssociateServiceRoleToAccount.name: AssociateServiceRoleToAccount

CreateConnectorDefinition.documentation: Creates a connector definition. You may provide the initial version of the connector definition now or use ''CreateConnectorDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.
CreateConnectorDefinition.name: CreateConnectorDefinition

CreateConnectorDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a connector definition which has already been defined.
CreateConnectorDefinitionVersion.name: CreateConnectorDefinitionVersion

CreateCoreDefinition.documentation: Creates a core definition. You may provide the initial version of the core definition now or use ''CreateCoreDefinitionVersion'' at a later time. Greengrass groups must each contain exactly one Greengrass core.
CreateCoreDefinition.name: CreateCoreDefinition

CreateCoreDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a core definition that has already been defined. Greengrass groups must each contain exactly one Greengrass core.
CreateCoreDefinitionVersion.name: CreateCoreDefinitionVersion

CreateDeployment.documentation: Creates a deployment. ''CreateDeployment'' requests are idempotent with respect to the ''X-Amzn-Client-Token'' token and the request parameters.
CreateDeployment.name: CreateDeployment

CreateDeviceDefinition.documentation: Creates a device definition. You may provide the initial version of the device definition now or use ''CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.
CreateDeviceDefinition.name: CreateDeviceDefinition

CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a device definition that has already been defined.
CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion.name: CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion

CreateFunctionDefinition.documentation: Creates a Lambda function definition which contains a list of Lambda functions and their configurations to be used in a group. You can create an initial version of the definition by providing a list of Lambda functions and their configurations now, or use ''CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion'' later.
CreateFunctionDefinition.name: CreateFunctionDefinition

CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a Lambda function definition that has already been defined.
CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion.name: CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion

CreateGroup.documentation: Creates a group. You may provide the initial version of the group or use ''CreateGroupVersion'' at a later time. Tip: You can use the ''gg_group_setup'' package (https://github.com/awslabs/aws-greengrass-group-setup) as a library or command-line application to create and deploy Greengrass groups.
CreateGroup.name: CreateGroup

CreateGroupCertificateAuthority.documentation: Creates a CA for the group. If a CA already exists, it will rotate the existing CA.
CreateGroupCertificateAuthority.name: CreateGroupCertificateAuthority

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the new active CA ARN.

CreateGroupVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a group which has already been defined.
CreateGroupVersion.name: CreateGroupVersion

output.documentation: Success. The response contains information about the group version.

CreateLoggerDefinition.documentation: Creates a logger definition. You may provide the initial version of the logger definition now or use ''CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.
CreateLoggerDefinition.name: CreateLoggerDefinition

CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a logger definition that has already been defined.
CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion.name: CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion

CreateResourceDefinition.documentation: Creates a resource definition which contains a list of resources to be used in a group. You can create an initial version of the definition by providing a list of resources now, or use ''CreateResourceDefinitionVersion'' later.
CreateResourceDefinition.name: CreateResourceDefinition

CreateResourceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a resource definition that has already been defined.
CreateResourceDefinitionVersion.name: CreateResourceDefinitionVersion

CreateSoftwareUpdateJob.documentation: Creates a software update for a core or group of cores (specified as an IoT thing group.) Use this to update the OTA Agent as well as the Greengrass core software. It makes use of the IoT Jobs feature which provides additional commands to manage a Greengrass core software update job.
CreateSoftwareUpdateJob.name: CreateSoftwareUpdateJob

CreateSubscriptionDefinition.documentation: Creates a subscription definition. You may provide the initial version of the subscription definition now or use ''CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.
CreateSubscriptionDefinition.name: CreateSubscriptionDefinition

CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Creates a version of a subscription definition which has already been defined.
CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.name: CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion

DisassociateRoleFromGroup.documentation: Disassociates the role from a group.
DisassociateRoleFromGroup.name: DisassociateRoleFromGroup

DisassociateServiceRoleFromAccount.documentation: Disassociates the service role from your account. Without a service role, deployments will not work.
DisassociateServiceRoleFromAccount.name: DisassociateServiceRoleFromAccount

GetAssociatedRole.documentation: Retrieves the role associated with a particular group.
GetAssociatedRole.name: GetAssociatedRole

GetBulkDeploymentStatus.documentation: Returns the status of a bulk deployment.
GetBulkDeploymentStatus.name: GetBulkDeploymentStatus

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the status of the bulk deployment.

GetConnectivityInfo.documentation: Retrieves the connectivity information for a core.
GetConnectivityInfo.name: GetConnectivityInfo

GetConnectorDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a connector definition.
GetConnectorDefinition.name: GetConnectorDefinition

GetConnectorDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a connector definition version, including the connectors that the version contains. Connectors are prebuilt modules that interact with local infrastructure, device protocols, AWS, and other cloud services.
GetConnectorDefinitionVersion.name: GetConnectorDefinitionVersion

GetCoreDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a core definition version.
GetCoreDefinition.name: GetCoreDefinition

GetCoreDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a core definition version.
GetCoreDefinitionVersion.name: GetCoreDefinitionVersion

GetDeploymentStatus.documentation: Returns the status of a deployment.
GetDeploymentStatus.name: GetDeploymentStatus

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the status of the deployment for the group.

GetDeviceDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a device definition.
GetDeviceDefinition.name: GetDeviceDefinition

GetDeviceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a device definition version.
GetDeviceDefinitionVersion.name: GetDeviceDefinitionVersion

GetFunctionDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a Lambda function definition, including its creation time and latest version.
GetFunctionDefinition.name: GetFunctionDefinition

GetFunctionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a Lambda function definition version, including which Lambda functions are included in the version and their configurations.
GetFunctionDefinitionVersion.name: GetFunctionDefinitionVersion

GetGroupCertificateAuthority.documentation: Retreives the CA associated with a group. Returns the public key of the CA.
GetGroupCertificateAuthority.name: GetGroupCertificateAuthority

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

GetGroupCertificateConfiguration.documentation: Retrieves the current configuration for the CA used by the group.
GetGroupCertificateConfiguration.name: GetGroupCertificateConfiguration

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

GetGroupVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a group version.
GetGroupVersion.name: GetGroupVersion

GetLoggerDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a logger definition.
GetLoggerDefinition.name: GetLoggerDefinition

GetLoggerDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a logger definition version.
GetLoggerDefinitionVersion.name: GetLoggerDefinitionVersion

GetResourceDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a resource definition, including its creation time and latest version.
GetResourceDefinition.name: GetResourceDefinition

GetResourceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a resource definition version, including which resources are included in the version.
GetResourceDefinitionVersion.name: GetResourceDefinitionVersion

GetServiceRoleForAccount.documentation: Retrieves the service role that is attached to your account.
GetServiceRoleForAccount.name: GetServiceRoleForAccount

GetSubscriptionDefinition.documentation: Retrieves information about a subscription definition.
GetSubscriptionDefinition.name: GetSubscriptionDefinition

GetSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Retrieves information about a subscription definition version.
GetSubscriptionDefinitionVersion.name: GetSubscriptionDefinitionVersion

ListBulkDeploymentDetailedReports.documentation: Gets a paginated list of the deployments that have been started in a bulk deployment operation, and their current deployment status.
ListBulkDeploymentDetailedReports.name: ListBulkDeploymentDetailedReports

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the list of deployments for the given group.

ListBulkDeployments.documentation: Returns a list of bulk deployments.
ListBulkDeployments.name: ListBulkDeployments

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the list of bulk deployments.

ListConnectorDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a connector definition, which are containers for connectors. Connectors run on the Greengrass core and contain built-in integration with local infrastructure, device protocols, AWS, and other cloud services.
ListConnectorDefinitionVersions.name: ListConnectorDefinitionVersions

ListConnectorDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of connector definitions.
ListConnectorDefinitions.name: ListConnectorDefinitions

ListCoreDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a core definition.
ListCoreDefinitionVersions.name: ListCoreDefinitionVersions

ListCoreDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of core definitions.
ListCoreDefinitions.name: ListCoreDefinitions

ListDeployments.documentation: Returns a history of deployments for the group.
ListDeployments.name: ListDeployments

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the list of deployments for the given group.

ListDeviceDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a device definition.
ListDeviceDefinitionVersions.name: ListDeviceDefinitionVersions

ListDeviceDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of device definitions.
ListDeviceDefinitions.name: ListDeviceDefinitions

ListFunctionDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a Lambda function definition.
ListFunctionDefinitionVersions.name: ListFunctionDefinitionVersions

ListFunctionDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of Lambda function definitions.
ListFunctionDefinitions.name: ListFunctionDefinitions

output.documentation: Success. The response contains the IDs of all the Greengrass Lambda function definitions in this account.

ListGroupCertificateAuthorities.documentation: Retrieves the current CAs for a group.
ListGroupCertificateAuthorities.name: ListGroupCertificateAuthorities

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

ListGroupVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a group.
ListGroupVersions.name: ListGroupVersions

output.documentation: Success. The response contains the list of versions and metadata for the given group.

ListLoggerDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a logger definition.
ListLoggerDefinitionVersions.name: ListLoggerDefinitionVersions

ListLoggerDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of logger definitions.
ListLoggerDefinitions.name: ListLoggerDefinitions

ListResourceDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a resource definition.
ListResourceDefinitionVersions.name: ListResourceDefinitionVersions

ListResourceDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of resource definitions.
ListResourceDefinitions.name: ListResourceDefinitions

output.documentation: The IDs of all the Greengrass resource definitions in this account.

ListSubscriptionDefinitionVersions.documentation: Lists the versions of a subscription definition.
ListSubscriptionDefinitionVersions.name: ListSubscriptionDefinitionVersions

ListSubscriptionDefinitions.documentation: Retrieves a list of subscription definitions.
ListSubscriptionDefinitions.name: ListSubscriptionDefinitions

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Retrieves a list of resource tags for a resource arn.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

output.documentation: Success. The group's deployments were reset.

StartBulkDeployment.documentation: Deploys multiple groups in one operation. This action starts the bulk deployment of a specified set of group versions. Each group version deployment will be triggered with an adaptive rate that has a fixed upper limit. We recommend that you include an ''X-Amzn-Client-Token'' token in every ''StartBulkDeployment'' request. These requests are idempotent with respect to the token and the request parameters.
StartBulkDeployment.name: StartBulkDeployment

StopBulkDeployment.documentation: Stops the execution of a bulk deployment. This action returns a status of ''Stopping'' until the deployment is stopped. You cannot start a new bulk deployment while a previous deployment is in the ''Stopping'' state. This action doesn't rollback completed deployments or cancel pending deployments.
StopBulkDeployment.name: StopBulkDeployment

output.documentation: Success. The bulk deployment is being stopped.

TagResource.documentation: Adds tags to a Greengrass resource. Valid resources are 'Group', 'ConnectorDefinition', 'CoreDefinition', 'DeviceDefinition', 'FunctionDefinition', 'LoggerDefinition', 'SubscriptionDefinition', 'ResourceDefinition', and 'BulkDeployment'.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Remove resource tags from a Greengrass Resource.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateConnectivityInfo.documentation: Updates the connectivity information for the core. Any devices that belong to the group which has this core will receive this information in order to find the location of the core and connect to it.
UpdateConnectivityInfo.name: UpdateConnectivityInfo

UpdateGroupCertificateConfiguration.documentation: Updates the Certificate expiry time for a group.
UpdateGroupCertificateConfiguration.name: UpdateGroupCertificateConfiguration

output.documentation: Success. The response body contains the PKI Configuration.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the Greengrass group.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role you wish to associate with this group. The existence of the role is not validated.

AssociatedAt.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the role ARN was associated with the group.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the service role you wish to associate with your account.

AssociatedAt.documentation: The time when the service role was associated with the account.

Message.documentation: A message containing information about the error.

BulkDeployment.documentation: Information about a bulk deployment. You cannot start a new bulk deployment while another one is still running or in a non-terminal state.

BulkDeploymentArn.documentation: The ARN of the bulk deployment.

BulkDeploymentId.documentation: The ID of the bulk deployment.

CreatedAt.documentation: The time, in ISO format, when the deployment was created.

BulkDeploymentMetrics.documentation: Relevant metrics on input records processed during bulk deployment.

InvalidInputRecords.documentation: The total number of records that returned a non-retryable error. For example, this can occur if a group record from the input file uses an invalid format or specifies a nonexistent group version, or if the execution role doesn't grant permission to deploy a group or group version.

RecordsProcessed.documentation: The total number of group records from the input file that have been processed so far, or attempted.

RetryAttempts.documentation: The total number of deployment attempts that returned a retryable error. For example, a retry is triggered if the attempt to deploy a group returns a throttling error. ''StartBulkDeployment'' retries a group deployment up to five times.

BulkDeploymentResult.documentation: Information about an individual group deployment in a bulk deployment operation.

CreatedAt.documentation: The time, in ISO format, when the deployment was created.

DeploymentArn.documentation: The ARN of the group deployment.

DeploymentId.documentation: The ID of the group deployment.

DeploymentStatus.documentation: The current status of the group deployment: ''InProgress'', ''Building'', ''Success'', or ''Failure''.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The error message for a failed deployment

GroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the Greengrass group.

BulkDeploymentStatus.documentation: The current status of the bulk deployment.

ConnectivityInfo.documentation: Information about a Greengrass core's connectivity.

HostAddress.documentation: The endpoint for the Greengrass core. Can be an IP address or DNS.

Id.documentation: The ID of the connectivity information.

PortNumber.documentation: The port of the Greengrass core. Usually 8883.

Connector.documentation: Information about a connector. Connectors run on the Greengrass core and contain built-in integration with local infrastructure, device protocols, AWS, and other cloud services.

Id.documentation: A descriptive or arbitrary ID for the connector. This value must be unique within the connector definition version. Max length is 128 characters with pattern [a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+.

Parameters.documentation: The parameters or configuration that the connector uses.

ConnectorDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about the connector definition version, which is a container for connectors.

Connectors.documentation: A list of references to connectors in this version, with their corresponding configuration settings.

CertificateArn.documentation: The ARN of the certificate associated with the core.

Id.documentation: A descriptive or arbitrary ID for the core. This value must be unique within the core definition version. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''.

SyncShadow.documentation: If true, the core's local shadow is automatically synced with the cloud.

ThingArn.documentation: The ARN of the thing which is the core.

CoreDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a core definition version.

Cores.documentation: A list of cores in the core definition version.

AmznClientToken.documentation: A client token used to correlate requests and responses.

InitialVersion.documentation: Information about the initial version of the connector definition.

Name.documentation: The name of the connector definition.

tags.documentation: Tag(s) to add to the new resource.

CreationTimestamp.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the definition was created.

Id.documentation: The ID of the definition.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the definition was last updated.

LatestVersion.documentation: The ID of the latest version associated with the definition.

LatestVersionArn.documentation: The ARN of the latest version associated with the definition.

AmznClientToken.documentation: A client token used to correlate requests and responses.

ConnectorDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the connector definition.

Connectors.documentation: A list of references to connectors in this version, with their corresponding configuration settings.

CreationTimestamp.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the version was created.

Id.documentation: The ID of the parent definition that the version is associated with.

Tags.documentation: Tag(s) attached to the resource arn.

ConnectorDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the connector definition.

CoreDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the core definition.

DeviceDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the device definition.

FunctionDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the Lambda function definition.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the Greengrass group.

LoggerDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the logger definition.

ResourceDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the resource definition.

SubscriptionDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the subscription definition.

CreatedAt.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the deployment was created.

GroupArn.documentation: The ARN of the group for this deployment.

DeploymentType.documentation: The type of deployment. When used for ''CreateDeployment'', only ''NewDeployment'' and ''Redeployment'' are valid.

CertificateArn.documentation: The ARN of the certificate associated with the device.

Id.documentation: A descriptive or arbitrary ID for the device. This value must be unique within the device definition version. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''.

SyncShadow.documentation: If true, the device's local shadow will be automatically synced with the cloud.

ThingArn.documentation: The thing ARN of the device.

DeviceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a device definition version.

Devices.documentation: A list of devices in the definition version.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the Greengrass group.

DisassociatedAt.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the role was disassociated from the group.
The time when the service role was disassociated from the account.

FunctionArn.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function.

FunctionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the Lambda function.

Id.documentation: A descriptive or arbitrary ID for the function. This value must be unique within the function definition version. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''.

FunctionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration of the Lambda function.

EncodingType.documentation: The expected encoding type of the input payload for the function. The default is ''json''.

Environment.documentation: The environment configuration of the function.

Executable.documentation: The name of the function executable.

MemorySize.documentation: The memory size, in KB, which the function requires. This setting is not applicable and should be cleared when you run the Lambda function without containerization.

Pinned.documentation: True if the function is pinned. Pinned means the function is long-lived and starts when the core starts.

Timeout.documentation: The allowed function execution time, after which Lambda should terminate the function. This timeout still applies to pinned Lambda functions for each request.

FunctionConfigurationEnvironment.documentation: The environment configuration of the function.

AccessSysfs.documentation: If true, the Lambda function is allowed to access the host's /sys folder. Use this when the Lambda function needs to read device information from /sys. This setting applies only when you run the Lambda function in a Greengrass container.

Execution.documentation: Configuration related to executing the Lambda function

ResourceAccessPolicies.documentation: A list of the resources, with their permissions, to which the Lambda function will be granted access. A Lambda function can have at most 10 resources. ResourceAccessPolicies apply only when you run the Lambda function in a Greengrass container.

Variables.documentation: Environment variables for the Lambda function's configuration.

FunctionDefaultConfig.documentation: The default configuration that applies to all Lambda functions in the group. Individual Lambda functions can override these settings.

FunctionDefaultExecutionConfig.documentation: Configuration information that specifies how a Lambda function runs.

FunctionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a function definition version.

DefaultConfig.documentation: The default configuration that applies to all Lambda functions in this function definition version. Individual Lambda functions can override these settings.

Functions.documentation: A list of Lambda functions in this function definition version.

FunctionExecutionConfig.documentation: Configuration information that specifies how a Lambda function runs.

FunctionIsolationMode.documentation: Specifies whether the Lambda function runs in a Greengrass container (default) or without containerization. Unless your scenario requires that you run without containerization, we recommend that you run in a Greengrass container. Omit this value to run the Lambda function with the default containerization for the group.

FunctionRunAsConfig.documentation: Specifies the user and group whose permissions are used when running the Lambda function. You can specify one or both values to override the default values. We recommend that you avoid running as root unless absolutely necessary to minimize the risk of unintended changes or malicious attacks. To run as root, you must set ''IsolationMode'' to ''NoContainer'' and update config.json in ''greengrass-root/config'' to set ''allowFunctionsToRunAsRoot'' to ''yes''.

Gid.documentation: The group ID whose permissions are used to run a Lambda function.

Uid.documentation: The user ID whose permissions are used to run a Lambda function.

Message.documentation: A message containing information about the error.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the Greengrass group.

AssociatedAt.documentation: The time when the role was associated with the group.

AutoAddGroupOwner.documentation: If true, AWS IoT Greengrass automatically adds the specified Linux OS group owner of the resource to the Lambda process privileges. Thus the Lambda process will have the file access permissions of the added Linux group.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results, or ''null'' if there are no additional results.

LocalDeviceResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define a local device resource.

GroupOwnerSetting.documentation: Group/owner related settings for local resources.

SourcePath.documentation: The local absolute path of the device resource. The source path for a device resource can refer only to a character device or block device under ''/dev''.

LocalVolumeResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define a local volume resource.

DestinationPath.documentation: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

GroupOwnerSetting.documentation: Allows you to configure additional group privileges for the Lambda process. This field is optional.

SourcePath.documentation: The local absolute path of the volume resource on the host. The source path for a volume resource type cannot start with ''/sys''.

Component.documentation: The component that will be subject to logging.

Id.documentation: A descriptive or arbitrary ID for the logger. This value must be unique within the logger definition version. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''.

Space.documentation: The amount of file space, in KB, to use if the local file system is used for logging purposes.

Type.documentation: The type of log output which will be used.

LoggerDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a logger definition version.

Permission.documentation: The type of permission a function has to access a resource.

AmznClientToken.documentation: A client token used to correlate requests and responses.

Force.documentation: If true, performs a best-effort only core reset.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the Greengrass group.

Id.documentation: The resource ID, used to refer to a resource in the Lambda function configuration. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''. This must be unique within a Greengrass group.

Name.documentation: The descriptive resource name, which is displayed on the AWS IoT Greengrass console. Max length 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''. This must be unique within a Greengrass group.

ResourceDataContainer.documentation: A container of data for all resource types.

ResourceAccessPolicy.documentation: A policy used by the function to access a resource.

Permission.documentation: The permissions that the Lambda function has to the resource. Can be one of ''rw'' (read/write) or ''ro'' (read-only).

ResourceId.documentation: The ID of the resource. (This ID is assigned to the resource when you create the resource definiton.)

ResourceDataContainer.documentation: A container for resource data. The container takes only one of the following supported resource data types: ''LocalDeviceResourceData'', ''LocalVolumeResourceData'', ''SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceData'', ''S3MachineLearningModelResourceData'', ''SecretsManagerSecretResourceData''.

LocalDeviceResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define the local device resource.

LocalVolumeResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define the local volume resource.

S3MachineLearningModelResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define an Amazon S3 machine learning resource.

SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceDat.documentation: Attributes that define an Amazon SageMaker machine learning resource.

SecretsManagerSecretResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define a secret resource, which references a secret from AWS Secrets Manager.

ResourceDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a resource definition version.

ResourceDownloadOwnerSetting.documentation: The owner setting for downloaded machine learning resources.

GroupOwner.documentation: The group owner of the resource. This is the name of an existing Linux OS group on the system or a GID. The group's permissions are added to the Lambda process.

GroupPermission.documentation: The permissions that the group owner has to the resource. Valid values are ''rw'' (read/write) or ''ro'' (read-only).

S3MachineLearningModelResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define an Amazon S3 machine learning resource.

DestinationPath.documentation: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

S3Uri.documentation: The URI of the source model in an S3 bucket. The model package must be in tar.gz or .zip format.

S3UrlSignerRole.documentation: The IAM Role that Greengrass will use to create pre-signed URLs pointing towards the update artifact.

SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceDat.documentation: Attributes that define an Amazon SageMaker machine learning resource.

DestinationPath.documentation: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

SageMakerJobArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon SageMaker training job that represents the source model.

SecretsManagerSecretResourceData.documentation: Attributes that define a secret resource, which references a secret from AWS Secrets Manager. AWS IoT Greengrass stores a local, encrypted copy of the secret on the Greengrass core, where it can be securely accessed by connectors and Lambda functions.

ARN.documentation: The ARN of the Secrets Manager secret to make available on the core. The value of the secret's latest version (represented by the ''AWSCURRENT'' staging label) is included by default.

AdditionalStagingLabelsToDownload.documentation: Optional. The staging labels whose values you want to make available on the core, in addition to ''AWSCURRENT''.

SoftwareToUpdate.documentation: The piece of software on the Greengrass core that will be updated.

AmznClientToken.documentation: A client token used to correlate requests and responses.

ExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the execution role to associate with the bulk deployment operation. This IAM role must allow the ''greengrass:CreateDeployment'' action for all group versions that are listed in the input file. This IAM role must have access to the S3 bucket containing the input file.

InputFileUri.documentation: The URI of the input file contained in the S3 bucket. The execution role must have ''getObject'' permissions on this bucket to access the input file. The input file is a JSON-serialized, line delimited file with UTF-8 encoding that provides a list of group and version IDs and the deployment type. This file must be less than 100 MB. Currently, AWS IoT Greengrass supports only ''NewDeployment'' deployment types.

tags.documentation: Tag(s) to add to the new resource.

BulkDeploymentArn.documentation: The ARN of the bulk deployment.

BulkDeploymentId.documentation: The ID of the bulk deployment.
The ID of the bulk deployment.

Id.documentation: A descriptive or arbitrary ID for the subscription. This value must be unique within the subscription definition version. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''.

Source.documentation: The source of the subscription. Can be a thing ARN, a Lambda function ARN, a connector ARN, 'cloud' (which represents the AWS IoT cloud), or 'GGShadowService'.

Subject.documentation: The MQTT topic used to route the message.

Target.documentation: Where the message is sent to. Can be a thing ARN, a Lambda function ARN, a connector ARN, 'cloud' (which represents the AWS IoT cloud), or 'GGShadowService'.

SubscriptionDefinitionVersion.documentation: Information about a subscription definition version.

TagResourceRequest.documentation: A map of the key-value pairs for the resource tag.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

Tags.documentation: The key-value pair for the resource tag.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

TagKeys.documentation: An array of tag keys to delete

UpdateAgentLogLevel.documentation: The minimum level of log statements that should be logged by the OTA Agent during an update.

Message.documentation: A message about the connectivity info update request.

Version.documentation: The new version of the connectivity info.

ConnectorDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the connector definition.

CoreDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the core definition.

DeviceDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the device definition.

FunctionDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the Lambda function definition.

CertificateExpiryInMilliseconds.documentation: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires, in milliseconds.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the Greengrass group.

CertificateAuthorityExpiryInMilliseconds.documentation: The amount of time remaining before the certificate authority expires, in milliseconds.

CertificateExpiryInMilliseconds.documentation: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires, in milliseconds.

GroupId.documentation: The ID of the group certificate configuration.
The ID of the Greengrass group.

LoggerDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the logger definition.

ResourceDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the resource definition.

SubscriptionDefinitionId.documentation: The ID of the subscription definition.

UpdateTargets.documentation: The ARNs of the targets (IoT things or IoT thing groups) that this update will be applied to.

UpdateTargetsArchitecture.documentation: The architecture of the cores which are the targets of an update.

UpdateTargetsOperatingSystem.documentation: The operating system of the cores which are the targets of an update.

CreationTimestamp.documentation: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the version was created.

Id.documentation: The ID of the parent definition that the version is associated with.
